Far Cry 3 System Requirements

Minimum system requirements

OS: Windows XP, Vista or Windows 7

RAM: 4 GB

DX: 9
Sound Card: DirectX 9 Compatible

SUPPORTED VIDEO CARDS

Nvidia GeForce GTX 8800 / GTX 9000 / GT 200 / GT 400 / GT 500 / GT 600 series

I'm having a problem. Before I start, I'm not new to torrents, or BlackBox games, or anything of the sort. I've tried installing 4 times, same error each time. I get to 93.9% and the error occurs.

The popup dialog for the error is labeled as ISDone.dll. The content of the error message is as follows : 
An error occurred while unpacking: Unable to write data to disk! 
Unarc.dll returned an error code: 11. 
ERROR: file write operation failed

Unsure as to how to solve the problem. I suppose it's possible the download was just corrupted somehow, am currently trying to download again, but a solution would be nice.

Problem retracted. 

For anyone else who ever happens to experience such a problem, apparently it's due to the nature of unarchiving and installing. There needs to be a certain amount of free space beyond the amount required for the installation. I just needed to free up a little bit and presto, it works.

Thanks mrGREEK360 for your answer.  Really appreciate it.  

@Dimmis80: To block a program in firewall, follow these steps.  I got this from google search a while ago.  It may look like a long step but it really isn't.  It will take you 5 min to do the first try but after that, only 30 sec~1 min if you have to block another program in the future.

1. Press the key combination Windows logo key + R to open the Run dialog.

2. Type wf.msc in the Run dialog and press Enter. This would open the Windows Firewall with Advanced Secruity window.

3. Click on the Outbound Rules in the left side menu in the Windows Firewall window,

4. Click on the New Rule... on the right side menu,

5. In the New Outbound Rule Wizard, select Program in Rule Type window and click Next,

6. In the Program window, either manually type the full path and file name of the program you want to block, or click on the Browse button to browse the program file. Click Next to continue.

7. In the Action window, select Block the connection and click Next,

8.  In the Profile window, select all options and click Next,

10.  In the Name window, give a name to the new rule like Block Explorer.exe and click Finish
